title: Woman 'lied about rape by two footballers to get sympathy from prospective boyfriend' | Metro News
text:
Richard Hartley-Parkinson for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 8:04 am Nikki Yovino has been charged with falsely reporting a rpae (Picture: Bridgeport Police Department) 
A woman has been charged with making up a false rape allegation against two American footballers. 
Nikki Yovino allegedly made up the attack so that she would get sympathy from a potential love interest. What is an exoplanet, how many are there and how were they discovered? 
The student from South Setauket, New York, has now been charged with falsely reporting an incident and tampering with or fabricating physical evidence. 
The 18-year-old Yovino said two Sacred Heart University football players sexually assaulted her in a bathroom in October during an off-campus party. 
The men said they had sex with her and it was consensual. Yovino allegedly wanted to get sympathy from a prospective boyfriend (Picture: Facebook) 
Police said she told them: ‘I don’t want to be in here, I don’t want to do anything. My friends are waiting for me outside, let me go outside.’ 
Captain Brian Fitzgerald tells WABC-TV another student informed authorities of explicit text messages between the three and other students had said she had gone into the bathroom willingly. He says one man also recorded some of the incident on his cellphone. Family of nine 'gang raped drunk woman for two hours as she pleaded for them to stop' 
Legal papers state: ‘She admitted that she made up the allegation of sexual assault against (the football players) because it was the first thing that came to mind and she didn’t want to lose (another male student) as a friend and potential boyfriend. 
‘She stated that she believed when (the other male student) heard the allegation it would make him angry and sympathetic to her.’ 
However, Yovino’s lawyer, Mark Sherman, told The Connecticut Post his client stands by her original story. 
She has been released on bail but faces a possible prison sentence of five years if found guilty. More
